english: eat to fullness; be full; have eaten enough

etymology.description: 吃(eat) + 饱(full) = eat to fullness; be full.
etymology.interpretation: Indicates the action of eating has reached the result of being full, i.e., having eaten enough. Common in patterns like 吃饱了/没吃饱 to state completion or lack thereof.
etymology.simplification: 飽 → 饱 by simplifying the 飠/食 radical to 饣; 吃 is unchanged. Standard radical reduction in Simplified Chinese.

examples.chinese: 我已经吃饱了(我已經吃飽了)。
中午没吃饱(中午沒吃飽)，下午很快又饿了(下午很快又餓了)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngwǔ méi chī bǎo, xiàwǔ hěn kuài yòu è le.
examples.english: I didn’t eat enough at noon, and I got hungry again in the afternoon.

examples.chinese: 他吃饱了就去散步(他吃飽了就去散步)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chī bǎo le jiù qù sànbù.
examples.english: After he ate his fill, he went for a walk.
